intro: Kibessia tessellata, commonly known as the tessellated kibessia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a textured, tessellated appearance. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Kibessia tessellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
